summary: The osprey is a large bird of prey found worldwide, except in Antarctica. It has a brown back and a greyish head and underside. This bird hunts fish during the day, using its sharp eyesight. Ospreys can grow up to 24 inches long, with a wingspan of 71 inches. They build nests near water bodies, as they mainly eat fish. Due to its unique fishing skills and physical features, the osprey has its own scientific classification.
title: Osprey
